bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 94 (Tuesday, May 19, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. SPANO:H.R. 6920.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8[Page H2270]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

item.name: Emergency medical services and trauma care

summary.text:
Keep Employees' Earnings Protected Act of 2020

This bill allows employers to suspend payment of payroll taxes (i.e., employer and employee taxes and self-employment taxes) for the period beginning on the enactment of this bill and ending either 90 days later, or upon the termination of the COVID-19 (i.e., coronavirus disease 2019) emergency period, whichever is shorter. The bill authorizes transfers to specified Social Security trust funds to cover the loss of revenue to such funds resulting from this payroll tax suspension.

bill.title: Keep Employees’ Earnings Protected Act of 2020

item.title: Keep Employees’ Earnings Protected Act of 2020
To temporarily suspend payroll taxes during the emergency relating to COVID-19.
Keep Employees’ Earnings Protected Act of 2020

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
